title: Ticket #1752: The -DumpRescue option should work if parsing fails
description: If you have the -DumpRescue option set, DAGMan should dump a rescue DAG (maybe with a different name) even if parsing the DAG fails, so you can see what DAGMan had up to the failure point.
remarks:
2010-Nov-04 11:57:09 by wenger:
Pete and I just discussed this, and we agreed that, when a rescue DAG is dumped for a failed parse attempt, the rescue DAG should contain a special keyword like "REJECT" or "FAIL" that will cause an attempt to run that DAG to fail. (This is because, in the case of a parse failure, the dumped rescue DAG may actually be syntactically correct, but incomplete.) When we run such a failure DAG, I think we shouldn't generate another rescue DAG, though.
